boat.construction_details: Carvel pitch pine on sawn & steamed oak frames Kauri laid deck
boat.full_description:
Commissioned for the artist Robert Groves to sail in the western isles of Scotland, 'Sheila' was built in 1905 and is still sailing, without an engine. She was based on the River Deben, Suffolk, England for many years until being sold to a new owner in Brittany, 2016.

Read an account of 'Sheila' taking part in the Lambay Race, Dublin, 1921 amongst the Howth 17-footers on 'Sailing by'.
boat.name: Sheila
boat.short_description: Sheila was Albert Strange's first deep-keel yacht commission, for the artist Robert Groves to sail in the western isles of Scotland. She was built in 1905 and is probably the oldest Strange yacht.
